node.title: Indigenous culture to be celebrated as WBBL launches inaugural First Nations Round
node.alt: Five women standing together arm in arm
node.description: The WBBL will hold its first league-wide First Nations Round this season, celebrating the hundreds of traditional custodians of the land that cricket is played on.
node.content:
["Ella Hayward is one of just five Indigenous players currently playing in the Women's Big Bash League.", "That Is something the Melbourne Renegades' spin bowler hopes to change, as the league makes moves to celebrate and recognise its Indigenous people.", "\"It's really awesome to represent my tribe and my culture,\" Hayward said.", "She will get to do just that when the WBBL and Big Bash League hold the\u00a0first league-wide First Nations Round\u00a0this season, celebrating\u00a0the hundreds of First Nations players and traditional custodians of the land that cricket is played on.", "The WBBL's\u00a0five Indigenous players were\u00a0joined by Kaurna elders and a number of non-Indigenous players in Adelaide this morning, launching the round with\u00a0a traditional basket-weaving activity.", "Hayward, an 18-year-old Jawoyn woman, is not only playing\u00a0for the league's current top team, but is also balancing year 12 exams at the same time.", "", "
Melbourne Renegades bowler Ella Hayward (right) celebrates after bowling Meg Lanning.(Getty Images:\u00a0Mark Brake)
", "But that has not hurt her form. She\u00a0clean bowled\u00a0Australia and Melbourne Stars captain Meg Lanning\u00a0with her first delivery at Adelaide Oval yesterday.", "\"I've had really good opportunities to get the chance to bowl to her, and to actually get her out was really rewarding.", "\"We knew how dangerous she was going into that game and she did look in good touch as well, so it was just good to get that breakthrough.\"", "
'It's awesome to represent my tribe and culture'
", "Hayward\u00a0said it was\u00a0incredible to be able to share her culture with others, and for the league to embrace\u00a0First Nations people.", "", "
Two players from the Sydney Thunder try basket weaving at the WBBL's First Nations Round launch in Adelaide.(Getty Images: Sarah Reed)
", "\"It means a lot, obviously being my background,\" she said.", "\"It's super awesome to see an actual round and so much traction around Indigenous culture in cricket.\"", "Muruwari woman and Sydney Sixers allrounder Ashleigh Gardner said this morning's launch gave players a chance to share their stories and to learn traditional Indigenous techniques.", "\"It's nice to have all five Indigenous players in the one place at the one time,\" Gardner said.", "\"This is the only place where we're all actually in the one spot.\"", "All players were dressed in their uniforms designed by Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander artists, each with their own unique stories connected to the traditional lands of each club.", "\"To be able to recognise and celebrate our rich and diverse culture \u2014\u00a0it's something that I've been longing for for seven seasons now \u2014 and to finally have it and to have an amazing strip to wear as well [is great],\" Gardner said.", "
'You can't be what you can't see'
", "With only a small number of Indigenous players currently competing at the top level, Gardner\u00a0hopes she can\u00a0help blaze a trail for others to follow in the future.", "", "
Sydney Sixers allrounder\u00a0Angela Reakes tries basket weaving at the WBBL First Nations Round launch in Adelaide.(Getty Images: Sarah Reed)
", "\"To have a beautiful symbol like this to show people that there is something to strive for and there are role models that they can aspire to be like,\" she said.", "\"When I was a young kid I never thought I'd be playing for Australia or the Sydney Sixers \u2026 you can't be what you can't see. And there hasn't been those people for those kids to look up to.", "The WBBL First Nations Round\u00a0will be played from\u00a0November 17-21 on the lands of the Kaurna people at Adelaide Oval and Yuwibara people at Great Barrier Reef Arena in Mackay.", "The round will begin with the Faith Thomas Trophy match between Adelaide Strikers and Perth Scorchers.", "The BBL First Nations Round will be held from January 8-14 in venues nationwide, culminating in the Strikers and Scorchers playing for the Jason Gillespie Trophy."]
